result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Homeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: from Plea & Sentencing Hearing dated 4-27-15
State Exh. 1 - Supplemental Narrative by Sgt. Carl Waterstreet Jr.

Defendant Michael R Homeyer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Michael R Homeyer in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Parties are prepared to proceed without PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. State's Exhibit 1 - offered and received. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-27-2015 03:30 pm
Email from VW coordinator Lisa M. advising matter will be a plea/sentencing hearing when matter is rescheduled.
from Atty Reetz asking to reschedule 4/27/15 hearing until after 1:00 because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-27-2015 02:30 pm
or Transport defendant for court on 4/27/15.
Jury trial at 05-19-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 04-27-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Michael R Homeyer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Michael R Homeyer in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant questions the State's offer. State indicates defendant needs to choose from offer today, joint recommendation of 8 years or capped at 12 years. Atty Reetz questions Atty Korb on offer, feels defendant should be able to choose when we get to sentencing. State withdraws their offer. Court will set matter for pretrial and trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Michael R Homeyer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Michael R Homeyer in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz needs more clarification of the offer, asks court to set a new plea date in the next couple of days. Atty Korb will try to reach Atty Pelrine to request clarification of offer. Court reschedules hearing for tomorrow, 2/24/15.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
or Transport defendant for court on 2/23/15.
or Transport defendant for court on 2/23/15.

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to set matter for a plea. State would like to see plea sooner rather than later.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Michael R Homeyer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Michael R Homeyer in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. No internet use. No access to any devices that can access the internet.

Defendant Michael R Homeyer appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Atty Gerbers indicates PD office will be appointing counsel to represent defendant. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
